content.description: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function given by <math alttext="f of x, equals, the fraction with numerator x squared, minus 9, and denominator sine x " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> on the closed interval <math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma 5, close bracket " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. Of the following intervals, on which can the Mean Value Theorem be applied to <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?
content.question: <math alttext="open bracket, 1 comma 3, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, because <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is continuous on <math alttext="open bracket, 1 comma 3, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> and differentiable on <math alttext="open parenthesis, 1 comma 3, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.<math alttext="open bracket, 4 comma 5, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, because <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is continuous on <math alttext="open bracket, 4 comma 5, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> and differentiable on <math alttext="open parenthesis, 4 comma 5, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.<math alttext="open bracket, 1 comma 4, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, because <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is continuous on <math alttext="open bracket, 1 comma 4, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> and differentiable on <math alttext="open parenthesis, 1 comma 4, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Provide reasons or rationales for solutions and conclusions.
